text: Bandipur National Park is a national park in India. It contains Gaurs and Asian Elephants, as well as tigers. In 1973 it was decided that Bandipur National Park would be protected as a place for tigers to live safely, as part of a project called 'Project Tiger'. The national park has an area of 874.20 km2. == References == Category:National parks in India
title: Bandipur National Park
